articles.headline: House Votes to Repeal Obamacare Tax Once Seen as Key to Health Law
articles.snippet: The so-called Cadillac tax on high-cost health plans, a key way the Affordable Care Act was supposed to pay for itself, was dealt a blow by an unlikely foe: Democrats.
articles.abstract: The so-called Cadillac tax on high-cost health plans, a key way the Affordable Care Act was supposed to pay for itself, was dealt a blow by an unlikely foe: Democrats.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the heat of the legislative fight over the Affordable Care Act, Obama administration officials argued that including a steep tax on high-cost, generous health insurance plans was critical to the law because it would hold down soaring costs while helping to pay for its expanded health benefits.

articles.headline: Netflix Stock Tumbles as U.S. Subscribers Decrease After Price Increases
articles.snippet: The drop in the second quarter was the first in 12 years of streaming. And while the company added 2.7 million customers worldwide, Wall Street had expected five million.
articles.abstract: The drop in the second quarter was the first in 12 years of streaming. And while the company added 2.7 million customers worldwide, Wall Street had expected five million.
articles.lead_paragraph: Netflix, the streaming juggernaut that has upended the entertainment industry, showed signs of vulnerability Wednesday when it reported that it had lost 126,000 paid subscribers in the United States during the second quarter. It was the first time the company had shed domestic streaming customers since it started its digital service 12 years ago and its shares fell sharply.

articles.headline: House Votes to Kill Trump Impeachment Resolution
articles.snippet: The House on Wednesday killed an attempt to impeach President Trump over statements the chamber already condemned as racist, exposing Democratic divisions.
articles.abstract: The House on Wednesday killed an attempt to impeach President Trump over statements the chamber already condemned as racist, exposing Democratic divisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House on Wednesday killed an attempt to impeach President Trump for statements that the chamber condemned this week as racist, turning aside an accusation that he had brought “ridicule, disgrace and disrepute” to his office.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: A Border Kept Him From His Daughter. He Came Only in Time to Say Goodbye.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRENTWOOD, N.Y. — Heydi Gámez García was discovered by her aunt just after midnight.
articles.byline: By Christina Goldbaum, Miriam Jordan and Christopher Lee

articles.headline: Why Leana Wen Quickly Lost Support at Planned Parenthood
articles.snippet: The departure of Dr. Wen, Planned Parenthood’s president, underscored a central tension: Is it a political organization first, or a health organization? And can it be both?
articles.abstract: The departure of Dr. Wen, Planned Parenthood’s president, underscored a central tension: Is it a political organization first, or a health organization? And can it be both?
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Leana Wen had already made a name for herself as Baltimore’s health commissioner when Planned Parenthood hired her as its new president last fall.
articles.byline: By Sarah Kliff and Shane Goldmacher

articles.headline: Suspected Arson at Kyoto Animation Studio Kills 33, Shocking Japan
articles.snippet: For the second time in two months, Japan is reeling from devastating apparent violence in a country that is generally considered one of the safest in the world.
articles.abstract: For the second time in two months, Japan is reeling from devastating apparent violence in a country that is generally considered one of the safest in the world.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — The attacker was heard screaming “Die!” as he ignited the liquid he had splashed around an anime studio in Japan.

articles.headline: Puerto Ricans in Protests Say They’ve Had Enough
articles.snippet: What’s Behind the Giant Protests in Puerto Rico?
articles.abstract: What’s Behind the Giant Protests in Puerto Rico?
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN JUAN, P.R. — In the crushing days after Hurricane Maria, Gov. Ricardo A. Rosselló declared in no uncertain terms, “Puerto Rico se levanta.” Puerto Rico rises.
articles.byline: By Patricia Mazzei and Frances Robles

articles.headline: Is Huawei a Security Threat? Vietnam Isn’t Taking Any Chances
articles.snippet: As the world splits along U.S.-China fault lines, telecom companies in Vietnam appear to be quietly avoiding the Chinese tech giant in their 5G plans.
articles.abstract: As the world splits along U.S.-China fault lines, telecom companies in Vietnam appear to be quietly avoiding the Chinese tech giant in their 5G plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: HANOI, Vietnam — The battle for technological dominance between the United States and China is splitting the world in two, though not always along the lines you might expect.
